comment: Has potential, but in my opinion too young.  A little harsh, but very good aftertaste.
not my favorite OF, but still pretty good. maybe i'm just a sucker for higher-proof bourbons, but i feel like this whiskey is missing something, compared to the bonded offerings...

I've been searching years for old Forrester birthday bourbon.  I've never been able to find it. This is one of two special release old Forrester during 2015.
    
    I'm told by those in the know both these releases are better than the 2015 birthday bourbon. I tried it I like it it's rather inexpensive. And it certainly is a step up from their regular 90 or 100  proof versions
Tasty bourbon. A the body is a little weaker than I like, but it's quite enjoyable.
Had at Farmhouse in Nashville. Smooth, subtle aroma (one ice cube). Almost like a rye. Will definitely get again.

I tried this at Saphire in Franklin, TN. I really liked it. The word that kept coming to mind was how "bright" this bourbon was. I guess that's the "fruit forward" that the description mentioned. It was very easy to drink. Too bad the pour was so stingy.
4.0 Not a real "favorite " but good none the less. Liked it more as the bottle emptied. Will buy when on sale. Little fruity. Made a good Old Fashioned.

I much prefer the Barrel Proof version of this, 1920, sometimes neat, or else as can water to taste. However, if watering down heavily to equal proof (at least without distilled water) than I prefer the 1870. This is one of the few bourbons with tropical fruit on the palette, which I excellent as I love anything Coconut.
For the price, it isn't a sipper. Makes a good mixer with all of the heat

Time for a stroll down Whiskey Row! The first of the three WR bottlings from Old Forester is the 1870 Original Batch. While there's still some of that signature OF spicy rye and cherry, there is a lot more of a sweet and fruity quality here. Buttered sweet corn, peaches, vanilla, caramel, cinnamon, and woody oak all come out to play, with a hint of some mint in the background. It finishes up a bit dry and short, but there's a little lingering wood and spice after everything else fades away. I'll bet this makes one honey of a mint julep. A nice, solid dram.
A bit more warmth than the prohibition style or bottled in Bond, would be great in the middle of winter or on a camping trip to warm the spirits. Still exceptionally smooth and flavorful
Sweet apply aroma. Spice. Heat. Pepper flavor. Easy drinking. Lovely.
Very smooth bourbon with little bite on the back end. Definitely a great sipping bourbon that I believe is too good to be mixed and should only be drank neat.
Needs a splash to open up

Lots of fruit and floral notes, bit of sweet carTally Some cinammom spices. Really pleasant to be honest. Really smooth mild taste with a little caramel and oak taste. Great bourbon to get for the collection
Good bourbon and is nothing like the modern old forester but still very good

mild nose of vanilla, cinnamon. taste is smooth, caramel and mote vanilla. would be better at higher proof, but well aged. disappointingly quick finish. a bit overpriced, many other good options at peicepoiymnt
Sweet, smooth lots of Carmel. Easy sipping whiskey. One of my new favorites
Very nice. Despite being the "lowest" of the Prohibition Row series, this wasn't too far off from the 1897 and 1920 offerings.
Very heavy oak flavors and a lot of alcohol burn. Didn’t get any of the vanilla or fruit flavors other people mentioned. Not my style of bourbon at all.

This was a very pleasant surprise, well balanced right after opening, which not all bourbons seem to be. It was sweeter than expected with less burn at end. I believe all the data for this that Distiller has is spot on. However, pause for effect.... no way does 
the 86 proof beat this like it shows in the ratings in this app. NO WAY. This has a chance to be my everyday at the end of my 
bourbon journey. Would give it 3.6 if I could, come on Distiller.... add halves please. 
10 months later and a 2nd go round with another bottle. Same as before, but it is better this time. After trying many other bourbons this is hands down on of my favorite pours. I like the sweet taste. Great work OF!
Better than statesman, worse than bottled in bond

Aroma had notes of toasted marshmallows, rye, and tobacco with some orange peel and vanilla in the background.  The palate had more toasted marshmallow along with a hint of cappuccino, some softer rye spice and orange peel, with a short vanilla and caramel finish. Very silky and velvety, it is a different and interesting expression of Old Forester.
tasted at Old Forester experience tour
tasted at the tour- MUCH milder than 86, smooth and caramel notes. good flavor.
Vanilla and leather, but also a lot of burn toward the end, even on the rocks.
Smooth finish, taste hints Carmel, vanilla and pepper
Easy to drink. Full. Good linger.
I’ve enjoyed this entire series but none have compared to the prohibition ale
Fruit (including cherry) dominates throughout; vanilla is present as well. Some bitterness on the back end that settles out with some more cherry and a touch of heat in the finish.
Disappointing, has a vaguely artificial finish.

On an empty stomach to the nose there was a sweet and caramel smell with little to no burn. On the pallet there was a rush of sweetness followed by a very very small hint of spice, most likely from the oak char; however, I would guess it to have a high corn mixture based on the sweetness.

Very pleasant nose; light fruit, oak and vanilla.  Palate is bright and fruity with some oak and cinnamon on the finish.  Very easy drinking with surprisingly spicy finish.  Great balance and overall great bourbon.
Definite pear on the nose, good flavor with baking spice taste. Light finish. Not sure this would hold up well in a cocktail...
A flavorful, solid sipping bourbon. Not quite as distinctive or enjoyable flavors as the 1920, but still full bodied and spicy in a good way. Finishes sweet with a kick of spice.
Great caramel color. Nose is caramel and spice. Taste is one dimensional with an alcohol finish. Kind of a one trick pony.

i get the vanilla on the nose, light body and quick finish.  I find a nice rye component though that I'm really enjoying, dunno if that's just me though.  I notice that the finish travels down the throat from the back of the mouth down into my chest in about 30 seconds.

Sample:  Neat in glen cairn glass

Appearance: (4.0)  Really nice reddish to amber hue.  Some legs.

Nose (3.0):  Bit of nail polish aroma which was a distraction followed with some vanilla and oak.

Palate:  (4.0):  Medium oaky with some baked apples and cinnamon.  Bit of spiciness but nothing overwhelming.  Vanilla intensifies from the nose.  A favorable palate.

Finish (3.75):  Quicker finish with a nice warming to it.  A bit of mint and a dash of pepperiness with woodsy character.  Very drinkable.  I liked the finish although I might have liked it to be a little longer 

I would definately buy again.  A nice compliment to Whiskey Row Collection.  I like 1920 a tad better.
I liked it the least of the 4 (not including 1910, but OF 100 proof present day).  1870 was the most mildest and has the shortest finish.
Solid, a little spice on the lips
When u just want to tell her u can’t wait to see her again.
This started strong and really mellowed out by the 3rd sip.
Super smooth, oak, cereal, cherry, jam, almond, tobacco, toasted oak, trail mix, grandmas house
Complex and spicy, fruit in the finish.  Some notes of floral essences.  I would buy this.

I'm partial to the Old Forester flavor profile, so I really like this one.  Light and fruity with a good balance of standard bourbon flavors.  I think a higher proof would enhance the body and deepen the flavor, so I'm looking forward to trying Old Forester Signature 100.
Good but the flavor disappears quick
Light and sweet, some oak and spice.  Quick finish with oak.  Very little heat.  Simple.

Glass: Deep cherrywood color
Nose: full of ripe fruit, preserves 
Palate: lighter in body but a wonderful, oily, cream texture. 
Finish: moderate, bright & inviting
Very nice.
Really smooth, hot on the back
April 2019 w/ charlie at DUrks. grea, smooth, not much bite.

Pours a nice copper that grows bolder the bigger the pour.  Nose is sweet, vanilla and spice.  Briefly soft at the front, then a nice bite in the middle.  Vanilla notes throughout with caramel coming through in the finish.

Cherry, vanilla, maple syrup, butterscotch, with some bean sprouts sharp greeness. Incredible Bourbon and near impossible to beat at it's price point. Easily a top 5 reliably findable Bourbons on the market

Bottle has had a chance to oxidize a bit. Almost too easy to drink. Lots of oak, lots of fruit, and a very creamy finish. Much better than Old Forester 86, but not sure if it’s worth the 2x price over OF86.
Dark rich flavors, like its color. Stands up to ice very well. Must try in an old fashioned or black Manhattan
Rich flavor of apple and cinnamon
Nose is butterscotch and sour apple. Pallet on the front is spices and green apple spices go into heat. Finishes off a little weak and doesn’t linger to much.
Solid bourbon, but nothing special.  Drinking this at a bar where it is reasonably priced.
Tried a while back and enjoyed
Fruity nose, caramel pallet, smooth finish would buy for sure

Im a big OF fan. The 1920, 1897 and Sig100 are elite bourbons imo. This is a lower proof take on the formula paying homage to heritage with the barrel blending. Poured neat, nose is fantastic. Candy apple, cherry pie with the dough latticed over the top, caramel and seasoned oak. Has the trademark varnish note I enjoy. Palate is heavy dose of nose traits plus some rye spice kick without the extra heat and drama of the higher proof making it more accessible. Experienced bourbon drinkers can still get onboard as the flavors are robust, deep and very satisfying. Great balance between the sweet dark fruity caramels and oak, even a little bit of chocolate sneaks in. Finish is traditional dying oak and cinnamon with fruity overtones that linger. I like the massive delivery of cask strength bourbons but this at 90 pf hits a sweet spot. I feel its a bit overpriced ( 38$ at Total wine) but enjoyable enough I might buy again.  Im a total OF fanboy so take that into account............89/100........lotsa yummy flavor with robust oak and sooooo easy to drink.....Think of Woodford with more barrel pop

The weakest of the whisky row, I really don't get anything out of this at all, not worth it in my option as it tastes like something from the bottom shelf and there are much cheaper options out there for that.
First taste has weird finish. Second taste is better
Very spicy, smooth. Sweet with dry finish. Very good neat.
Decent bourbon, light brown sugar then a burn and caramel and light oak

Nose - orange zest, butter cookie, cinnamon and cloves, vanilla and caramel
Taste - spice forward, then citrus, some vanilla and dried fruit
Finish - spice then sweetness, eh oh then fades back to a lingering spice, medium heat
Very good. Smooth and easy drinking.
Not bad, but not something to which I would return. It isn’t too hot, but smells and tastes significantly of ethanol.
Fairly one dimensional with a good amount of ethanol burn taste
Better smell but still a good drink. I like it
Smoothish, vanilla strong at the start finish with a lil spice
